answers.answer: Hi,Protein and blood in the urine may suggest disease involving the subunits of the kidneys called the glomerulus (or glomeruli) .Is the blood microscopic? If this is so,the shape and character of the red blood cells may help suggest where the bleeding takes place.The bleeding may occur from the lower urinary tract involving the urethra and bladder as well as from the microscopic tubules and ducts of the kidneys. The presence of protein requires further evaluation.As this pertains to an underlying kidney problem. A CT scan of the kidney ,ureter and bladder and a 24 hour urine collection for quantitative urine protein will help.Blood tests to determine kidney function , serum cholesterol levels and uric acid and electrolyte levels will be able to help.Do you have any underlying disease like hypertension and diabetes?

question: I have protein and blood in my urine.  Just wondering what casues this and what tests will the doctor do after urinalysis?
title: Protein and blood in the urine
